text.text: How do I add a PCS during claim creation?

text: To add a PCS during claim creation, you can: 1. In the Level of service & diagnosis tab, scroll to the bottom of the page. 2. Under the Physician Certification Statement heading, select Yes. This will open additional fields.

text.text: How do I add a PCS during claim creation?

text: To add a PCS during claim creation, you can: 1. In the Level of service & diagnosis tab, scroll to the bottom of the page. 2. Under the Physician Certification Statement heading, select Yes. This will open additional fields. You can also: Hover over Claims and click Authorizations to view a list of PCS and non-PCS, as well as their attachments, on file for all patients.

text.text: Where can I view a list of all PCS and non-PCS on file for all patients?

text: You can view a list of all PCS and non-PCS on file for all patients by hovering over Claims and clicking Authorizations. You can also view all the PCS on file for a patient by going to the patient's Account page > Coordination of Benefits tab.

text.text: How do I view all PCS on file for a specific patient?

text: You can view all the PCS on file for a patient by going to the patient's Account page > Coordination of Benefits tab. You can also view a list of all PCS and non-PCS on file for all patients by hovering over Claims and clicking Authorizations.

text.text: What steps do I follow to add a PCS to a completed claim?

text: To add a PCS to a completed claim, you can: 1. In the Level of service & diagnosis tab, scroll to the bottom of the page. 2. Under the Physician Certification Statement heading, select Yes. Selecting Yes opens additional fields.

text.text: What should I do if there are multiple PCS to add during claim creation?

text: You can add a PCS during claim creation or afterwords on the Claim page. To add a PCS, you can: 1. In the Level of service & diagnosis tab, scroll to the bottom of the page. 2. Under the Physician Certification Statement heading, select Yes. Selecting Yes opens additional fields.

text.text: Where can I find the PCS information on a completed claim?

text: You can find the PCS information on a completed claim in the Level of service & diagnosis tab. To find the information, you can: 1. Scroll to the bottom of the page. 2. Under the Physician Certification Statement heading, select Yes.

text.text: How can I link to an existing PCS file or import a new one during claim creation?

text: You can link to an existing PCS file or import a new one during claim creation by editing the "Incident details" tab.

text.text: How do I delete a PCS from a patient's account?

text: You can delete a PCS from a patient's account by going to the patient's Account page > Coordination of Benefits tab.

text.text: Where do I enter the PCS signer type and expiration date during claim creation?

text: You can enter the PCS signer type and expiration date in the Level of service & diagnosis tab.
